Pastry chef Betty Hung weaves Asian influences into her pastries at Beaucoup (milk tea croissants!), and they’re phenomenal.ORDER THE: extraordinary kouign-amann, salted chocolate rosemary cookie, peanut butter sandwich cookie, yuzu lemon tart, and a scone sandwich for lunch.THE VIBE IS: sunny and upscale, frequented by elegant Kitsilano residents.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open Tuesday to Friday, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.; and Saturday and Sunday, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. It’s nice to eat inside, but tables in the small bakery can be hard to come by, so consider getting your treats to go.—Lindsay AndersonYinger WongBetty HungWE ALSO LOVEEarnest Ice CreamGet the scoop on Vancouver’s young, ambitious ice cream empire MaenamReinvented Thai cuisine (and cocktails) in Kitsilano   The Pie ShoppeEast Vancouver’s beloved, scrappy, and downright delicious bakeryExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
